# Presentation example ![Presentation](cover.png) # With **RoxaPrez** *Valéry Bruniaux - https://github.com/ValeryBruniaux/RoxaPrez*
# ![Logo](logo.png) Summary ![Logo](logo.png) --- ### Mardown emphase & emoji ### Tables ### Lists and Sublists ### Code highlight ### Extras Features ### Conclusion
# ![Logo](logo.png) Markdown emphase & emoji ![Logo](logo.png) --- ### Supscript exe^mple^ ### Subscript exe~mple~ ### Emoji support :innocent: When you write any text you can use _Emphase_ or __big emphase__. You can also ==mark== with "== ==" and ++underline++ with "++ ++" or ~~Stroke this~~ and use blockquote : > Blockquote
# ![Logo](logo.png) Tables ![Logo](logo.png) --- ### Use tables with markdown syntax | Tables | Are | Cost | |:------------- |:-------------:| -----:| | col 3 is | right-aligned | 0 € | | col 2 is | centered | 0 € | | zebra stripes | are neat | 0 € | ### Move pointer over table cell to flash it !
# ![Logo](logo.png) Lists and Sublists ![Logo](logo.png) --- 1. First ordered list item 1. Another item 1. Ordered sub-list * Unordered sub-list. Unordered list can use asterisks - Or minuses + Or pluses 1. And another item. You can have properly indented paragraphs within list items. Notice the blank line above, and the leading spaces (at least one, but we'll use three here to also align the raw Markdown). To have a line break without a paragraph, you will need to use two trailing spaces.
# ![Logo](logo.png) Code highlight ![Logo](logo.png) --- ### You can insert highlight code ```javascript // ICI : delegated handler for double clicking document.addEventListener( "dblclick", function ( event ) { api.goto( "Overview" ); event.preventDefault(); }, false); ``` ```python s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s ``` You can use `inline code` of course ! Code with leading tab... ``` or with ``` ... ``` syntax... ```
